importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Since the winter of 2022, Russia has systematically targeted Ukraine’s energy infrastructure, marking the beginning of a sustained campaign to disrupt civilian heating and power supply.
On October 10, 2025, a massive drone and missile strike hit Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5, causing a near-total power and water outage for the capital and signaling a new phase in Russian tactics.
On August 28, 2025, Russian missiles struck a drone factory and apartment building in Kyiv, killing 22 civilians and highlighting the increasing lethality and precision of Russian attacks.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Russia’s sustained attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure from October 2022 to 2025 have created a long-term crisis in power and heating availability, with increasing sophistication and effectiveness.

keyTakeAways: Russia has significantly upgraded its drone and missile tactics, using faster, higher-altitude drones and software-modified missiles that evade Western air defenses.
The October 10, 2025 attack on Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5 destroyed critical power infrastructure, leaving millions without electricity and water for much of the day.

The attacks are specifically targeted at energy infrastructure, including power stations, natural gas delivery facilities, pipelines, and mines, in an effort to leave civilians defenseless during the harsh winter.
Russia’s improved missile evasion capabilities have reduced interception rates from 37% (August 2025) to just 6% (September 2025), dramatically increasing the threat level.

Corruption has undermined Ukraine’s ability to protect energy infrastructure, with officials reportedly inflating costs of anti-drone systems by up to 30%, diverting funds from effective protection measures.
Ukrainian civilians are preparing for severe shortages by buying power banks, gas canisters, electric blankets, and using wood stoves in defiance of fire regulations.
The situation threatens to result in a harsh winter with widespread blackouts and a near-collapse of energy systems, raising concerns about civilian survival and public health.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Russia has escalated its attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure, particularly targeting power stations and gas delivery facilities, using hundreds of advanced drones and software-modified missiles that evade Western defenses. The October 10, 2025 strike on Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5 devastated a key power source, leaving the capital without electricity and water for much of the day, and marking a shift from earlier attacks to a focused strategy designed to leave civilians defenseless during the harsh winter. Corruption and poor infrastructure planning have further weakened Ukraine’s ability to defend critical systems, while civilians are responding with personal preparations like gas canisters, power banks, and wood stoves. Analysts warn that the combination of increased attack sophistication, repeated strikes, and systemic vulnerabilities could lead to a severe winter crisis with widespread blackouts and humanitarian risks.
title: How Russia’s new tactics pose fresh winter threat to Ukraine
